intro.description:
Welcome to the tutorial to create some mappings.
It will step by step guide you through the process of retyping and renaming.
You must have loaded a source and a target schema before following this guide.

item.title: Retype
item.description:
You first need to retype once between features from your source and target schema.
Go to Edit -> Add relation... or click the corresponding button in the top toolbar to open the "New Relation" wizard.
Choose Retype and click Next.
Now choose a type from source and target.
Click Finish.
Alternatively you can select a source and target type in the Schema Explorer, click the arrow in between and choose Retype.
Then the Retype dialog opens, but with the selected types already chosen. Click Finish.

item.title: Rename
item.description:
After retyping you can now map attributes.
Again, go to Edit -> Add relation... or click the corresponding button in the top toolbar to open the "New Relation" wizard.
Choose Rename and click Next.
Now choose an attribute from source and target.
Click Finish.
Alternatively you can select a source and target type in the Schema Explorer, click the arrow in between and choose Rename.
Then the Retype dialog opens, but with the selected types already chosen. Click Finish.
